newsitem.title: CAMBODIA: Cambodia holds Frenchman on child sex charges.
newsitem.headline: Cambodia holds Frenchman on child sex charges.

text.p: Cambodian police are holding a middle-aged Frenchman suspected of child sex offences, a top officer said on Saturday.
Police General Skadavy M. Ly Roun of the Cambodia Interpol office said the 53-year-old photographer, named as Henion Amede, had been arrested at his Phnom Penh apartment on Friday.
"We arrested three children with him under 15 years of age," said the general.
Amede had been charged with rape, child prostitution and child molestation and faced a prison term of up to 20 years if convicted, he added.
The general said the suspect was being held at his office and had been arrested after being under surveillance for a week. He had been living in Cambodia since 1995.

The Frenchman was believed to be the third foreigner arrested in Cambodia for child sex offences since mid-1995. An Austrian was fined and deported while a British doctor was fined and jailed for five months after he was convicted in October 1995.
Child welfare groups have long warned that Cambodia was becoming a haven for local and foreign paedophiles.
